newsitem.title: UK: NWE fuel oil barges up, cargoes little talked.
newsitem.headline: NWE fuel oil barges up, cargoes little talked.

text.p: High sulphur fuel oil barges rose a little early on Friday, with traders saying higher prices paid for very prompt material while cargoes were little talked after trading steady late on Thursday.
High sulphur fuel barges fetched $89 and $90 fob Rotterdam for storage and refinery material respectively. This compared with Thursday's close at $89.25/$89.50 for refinery product.
Later offers rose to $91 and bids were at $89.50 for refinery material and $89 for RMG material.
Some traders said there were signs that demand had picked up a little.
"Bunker enquiries are a little higher," one said.

High sulphur fuel cargoes were little talked early, except for some Russian material, with traders saying that most of the requirements were bunker geared at the moment. But cargoes were assessed steady with swaps a little higher.
Russian M-100 high sulphur straight-run was said to have traded at two means plus $5 or a little higher late on Thursday, a price said to be reflective of the market.
There was unconfirmed talk of a cargo of bunker spec high sulphur cracked being sold at a strong high fob quote plus $5 out of Lavera.
